Reviews.Title: WARNING:  Do NOT use "Express Setup" - use only "CUSTOM Setup"
Reviews.Author: D. Cushman
Reviews.Content: Go ahead and read the 1-star reviews first, then come back and read THIS review, and you will quickly see that the problems the complainers are experiencing is because THEY WON'T READ AND FOLLOW SIMPLE DIRECTIONS, so the problems they describe are their own fault.  Those who followed simple directions gave the laptop 5 stars.People will throw away 100+ hours every month watching mindless television programs, but they won't invest just a few hours of their TV-watching life to learn how to use a computer.  Instead, they want manufacturers to make idiot-proof software so they don't have to actually READ (God forbid they might have to sacrifice an episode of some mindless television program), and if the manufacturer doesn't assist in enabling those people, then the manufacturer is vilified for not making moron-proof products.  Furthermore, those same people want the manufacturer to develop a laptop with the performance of a $1,200 unit, yet they want to pay less than $300 for that laptop! ....go figure.Ya just can't fix stupid.But take the experience of the complainers and be warned....when you first open and launch Windows 8, you will be presented with the option to select EXPRESS Setup or CUSTOM Setup.  If you do as all the nay-sayers did, and you mistakenly select Express Setup, you WILL have a slow-running laptop on your hands that constantly updates itself and throws popups at you.  However, if you wisely select CUSTOM Setup, you can easily disable all the unnecessary background apps that are not required for Windows 8 to run, and you will have a quick and fast little laptop like all of us that gave it 4 and 5 stars.  Don't be intimidated by the setup process.  Microsoft has made it fairly idiot-proof.  Keep reading....I've owned several different laptops over the years (Dell, HP, Lenovo and Sony brands), and I can confidently say this is a GREAT little laptop.  I wanted to get something small and compact for my 9 year old daughter for Christmas, but since most of the websites she visits require Flash, that immediately disqualified  anything with Chrome OS, Apple iOS, and Android OS.  So I wanted to find a small laptop with Windows OS as well as MS Office and a touchscreen.  When I found this laptop in December 2013, I was excited because it offers so much for so little.  However, I was skeptical because it was brand new to market and as of 12-15-2013, there were almost NO reviews out there I could rely on.  However, I invested 2 hours on this laptop before packaging it and handing it over to my daughter for Christmas, and I can confidently give this little beast 2 thumbs up.It IS very small - perfect for a young kid, teen or college student with small hands.  It is NOT for someone with large hands or bad vision (the small screen really shrinks everything down).  However, it's perfect for fitting right into a purse or backpack, and it comes with MS Office which is perfect for students (more on the MS Office installation further down in this review).  It's very thin, very lightweight, durable, and very compact.  It has a quality build to it - not cheap and flimsy.  My daughter already dropped it from 3 feet off the floor and it didn't crack or dent, and the hard drive wasn't affected in the least.BUT REMEMBER THE WARNING YOU MUST HEED:  when you power it up, you will be taken through a series of Windows 8 setup processes before you can use it, as well as setting up a personal Microsoft account (don't worry, no money or credit card required.  This is where the nay-sayers all went wrong.  I cannot emphasize enough how important it is to NOT select "Express Settings".  If you do, you WILL regret it.  There are a great deal of background apps and services that are defaulted to launch on Startup and constantly seek updates (including Windows itself).  Due to limited processing speed and memory on this laptop (in order for HP to sell it for $300 or under), all those apps running in the background will result in slow operation and response times. However, if you choose the Custom setup process, you can disable many unnecessary processes and updates that are not needed to run Windows 8.  I also advise NOT to set Windows to Automatic Updates.  You can manually update Windows yourself (I usually do this once a month).  Those processes are still available whenever you want them - but they do NOT need to automatically load and run in the background each time you start this laptop, so disable all the unnecessary apps and set them to manual.  If you choose Custom Setup, you will be walked right through this process and it's easy to complete.  But if you choose Express Setup, you will be defaulting them to run automatically on startup which is going to place a lot of unnecessary demand on the processor and memory, slowing the machine down and resulting in negative reviews, when in fact the problem is the user, not the laptop.  Simply disable the services that aren't required to run on Startup and it'll be quick and responsive.Sidebar:  I note that several of those who 1-star'd the laptop are claiming they selected Custom setup and still experience slow response from the laptop.  Okay, pay attention, please...... recall I said earlier "ya can't fix stupid".  That being said, even though you select Custom Setup, you still have to manually go through each and every option listed and you must DISABLE all those unnecessary apps!  You cannot simply select Custom Setup and then simply click Next, Next, Next on the prompt screens!  All that accomplishes is the same as selecting Express Setup, because all those unnecessary apps are still left running in the background.  I realize I'm stating the obvious here, but apparently stupidity runs rampant and knows no bounds, hence all the silly warning signs you now find on every product you buy (so as to protect people against their own stupidity).Here's another VERY important step:Once you have completed the Windows 8 setup process, you will need to open Internet Explorer, select Tools, and select Windows Update.  Even though Windows 8.1 comes installed on this laptop, there are dozens of new updates coming out all the time.  That process alone could take from 10 to 45 minutes to complete all necessary updates.  Once done, my advice is to go back into Control Panel and turn Windows Automatic Updates OFF.  Ignore all the dire warnings it will throw at you. You can manually update Windows anytime you want to.  There is no need to have all these processes always running in the background and taking up valuable processor and memory resources.  And don't forget to download and install Flash.  Plan on 2 hours to complete ALL setup steps and learning to add/remove/relocate apps on the new Windows 8 Start screen, as well as configuring the laptop to run only necessary Windows processes.  It's a bit time consuming but well worth the time invested.  If you choose to simply hit "Express" settings, then you'll be one of the unhappy reviewers like a few others here.  However, if you take my advice and select the custom manual setup and disable all those unnecessary apps, then you'll find it runs quick and you'll be quite happy with it.While others complained about Windows 8, I was impressed with the number of user-controlled settings that Windows is providing with this new OS, and the new tiled apps with a touchscreen are pretty cool.  The new Start Screen and tiles are new and different, but like anything that needs to be learned, I found it to have a lot of features I really liked.  You can add and remove tiles to your start screen, organize the tiles into groups, name the groups, etc.HP has created a website that teaches you everything you need to know to use Windows 8. At the bottom of this review, go to the Comments and click on page 2 where you will find the URL address that you can cut and paste into your browser.The touchscreen of this little laptop really impressed me.  I expected it to be a bit inaccurate and unresponsive like so many smartphone touchscreens are, but in fact it is VERY responsive and accurate, down to the tiniest little box to be checked with your finger.Picture quality of the screen is not high definition, but it's normal, and since it's a 10-inch screen, high definition detail cannot be seen anyway.  However, it does have a High Definition port to connect to a large HD monitor or television, and others have reported excellent video quality when connected to a TV screen or external monitor.  Video quality on the laptop itself is perfectly fine otherwise.Someone else mentioned slowness in streaming videos, but since I have a high broadband internet connection, I found that videos loaded fast and were absolutely flawless with no buffering or delay.  So that user's problem was NOT the laptop, it was her own limited broadband.The sound system on this laptop also impressed me.  It even comes with a built-in sound equalizer to customize sound to your personal tastes.If you're a hardcore online gamer, you are NOT going to be very happy with the AMD 1 Ghz processor, but then again, this laptop was not designed for heavy duty online gaming, and you can't expect an Intel i7 hyper-threading processor in a laptop under $300. You wouldn't reasonably expect to buy a little car with a 1.5 liter engine and then complain that it doesn't go from 0 to 60 mph in 4.5 seconds, right?  Understand that in order for HP to make this a low-priced $300 laptop, they had to put only 2 GB of memory in it and a simple AMD 1Ghz processor. For heavy online gamers or for running resource-intensive programs, this laptop is not sufficient. However, for normal everyday interactive gaming websites and other operating functionality for 90% of most people, it's great.  My daughter has had NO trouble at all, even with 3 different web browsers open (Firefox, Chrome and IE) and 4 other offline applications running simultaneously.  When launching apps, there is a slight delay of a few seconds, but otherwise the 1 Ghz AMD Processor speed and 2 GB RAM is fine for all applications.  If you want faster response and the ability to run programs or gaming software that puts heavy demand on the processor and memory, then you'll need to step up to a laptop in the range of $500 to $1,000.  But for basic computing, this laptop performs wonderfully.The speed and motion of the touchpad mouse is completely adjustable in the Control Panel, so the people that claim the touchpad is slow and unresponsive are simply proving my point that the nay-sayers are those that have not taken a few minutes of time to adjust and control all the various settings a computer or laptop makes available to users.  When you get into a car rental or someone else's car, you have to adjust the seat and mirrors to fit YOU so it's comfortable for YOU, right? Well, in like manner, on any laptop you need to adjust the touchpad to respond to your own touch and speed preference.  It's silly to simply accept the default settings and then complain about it!  If you don't know how to do something on any laptop or PC, just remember:  Google is your friend....Use it!  Everything and anything you want to learn is available at your fingertips through a simple Google search.  I often use Youtube to watch quick How-To videos to learn anything I need to know.I took 2 hours to complete all updates and adjust various settings and configurations before gifting it to my daughter, and this laptop works GREAT.  For anything I didn't know how to do on Windows 8.1, I simply Googled the question and found dozens of immediate How-To's.  Once I was done, I found the laptop to be fast and responsive with a LOT of functionality and excellent build quality.Oh, by the way:  When you open the box, there is a small yellow card with your MS Office activation code.  Do NOT throw it away!  You will need that activation code when you launch Office 2013 that comes pre-installed on this laptop.  It is Office Home and Student 2013, so it only includes Word, Excel and PowerPoint (it does NOT include Access, Publisher, Outlook or SharePoint), but the version this comes with is a FULL version for you to keep.  It is NOT a trial version.  To me, that makes this laptop a remarkable buy, because Office Home & Student 2013 is a $100 program, so considering the HP build quality, the touchscreen, a decent amount of processor speed and memory, as well as having Windows 8.1 fully installed (no upgrade required), that makes this $300 laptop the number one bargain laptop to be found anywhere in 2014. PERIOD.  You can find cheaper ones, but they won't even begin to compare to this one.All in all, I am absolutely amazed at how much value this laptop offers for such a low price and with excellent build quality.  I challenge anyone to find a laptop for under $300 that compares to this one.  Go ahead and search away, you will not find another laptop in this price range that has all this unit offers with the build quality of HP.  I find it to be THE best bargain in it's class.  And that's important to remember:  You're looking at a $300 laptop, so don't expect it to have 8 GB of memory and an Intel i7 processor!  But for under $300, I am amazed HP has packed so much quality and functionality into this thing.Just remember:  do NOT, do NOT, do NOT select "Express" setup when you first launch Windows 8 (on this laptop or ANY laptop for that matter!)  Select the CUSTOM manual setup and disable all the unnecessary processes that are defaulted to run on startup.  Yes, it's very easy to do.  You can do this during the setup process as well as after the fact.  That way, you'll have a fast little laptop you'll be very happy with.To prove my point, if you scroll through these reviews and search for another user named "Donna Mac", she wrote the following in her review:  "First of all I made the mistake of doing express setup, made the computer really slow. ... Decided to do a complete factory reset and that seemed to fix all the problems. I did a custom setup and the difference was amazing, everything is now running a lot smoother and faster."So there you have it!  Do NOT select "Express Setup" when Windows 8 launches.Other than Windows issues, my hat is off to HP for producing a low-priced laptop with so much quality and value.I highly recommend this unit.  I have worked with many different desktops, tablets and laptops throughout my workday for years, so I think my opinion can be relied upon.  Ignore the nay-sayers that don't want to learn how to set up and configure Windows 8.  Get yourself one of these.  It packs tremendous value and build quality for less than $300.  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: A Goldilocks computer; not too big, not too small, just right
Reviews.Author: World Traveler
Reviews.Content: Rating technology is tricky since it relys on the acumen of the user.  So first a bit about me.I am an average tech user. I know how to fix basic problems but I really don't care about the small details as long as my device is functional.Uses: Mainly this device would be for travel or meetings.Pros:  It is small 10.1 screenThe battery is detachable, which makes it easier to switch out.The battery life is decent: I got a little less than 5 hours from a mix of internet searches, video watching and photo editing.The operating system is actually 8.1.It came with Microsoft Office Home and Student.It was very easy to set up.It is a very functional little computer for a good price.It has built in Windows security softwareThe keyboard was just right for me but then I have rather small hands.It stays pretty cool when you have it on your lap for hours at a time.Cons:The touchscreen is responsive but I found that sometimes it was easy to accidentally go to a previous page or another screen entirely by touching the wrong part of the screen.It takes an inordinate amount of time to download things (but that could be attributed to my wifi)They have a somewhat limited selection of "apps" some of them (like a microphone) are already on your computer.The whole windows 8 interface is more of a step sideways than a step forward.There is not much information out there on this computer.  Not even on HP's website.  If you go looking for this elsewhere it has another name:HP Pavilion 10 TouchSmart 10z-e000 Notebook PC (ENERGY STAR)

Reviews.Title: GREAT DEVICE
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "BigAppleReport"
Reviews.Content: HP PAVILLION Touchsmart10-e010First, let me say that I got this HP laptop after trying two different Asus 1015Es, neither of which, among other issues, would stay connected to the internet. I really liked the Asus but anyway, it just didn't work out and the HP Pavilion Touchsmart was the same size and pretty much identical specs, or at least very similar.I read all the reviews and heeded other reviewers advice to bypass the Express Setup, which so far has prevented the endless downloads noted by some reviewers.Another problem noted by some reviewers was that the included Microsoft Office could A:  Not be successfully Activated and B: if you were successful in Activating it, you could not then subsequently find it.  Here is  the solution to both:I discovered that the key to successfully getting the enclosed Activtion key to work is that you first have to register the device with HP online.  Once I did that, I was able to easily activate and download the Office software.  HOWEVER, no Office icon appeared anywhere, so I had to search all over to find it.To actually find the program go to:c: program files/Microsoft Office 15/root/office 15/There you will see a ton of files that I have no idea what they are or what they do, but once you are there, look for the icons for Excel, Winword etc that say "application “way over the right.Next, hover your mouse on the program icon you want, right click and then click on "send to desktop" or "pin to taskbar" and you are good to go.WARNING:  Unless you are an expert, which I most definitely am NOT, don't mess with all those other files because as I say, I have no idea what they do.So far at least, I am loving this little laptop.  Considering the price, I think it’s a great buy.  Yes it is a bit slow when compared to a more powerful device, but what do you want for $300, especially considering you get the usually very expensive Office for free..  I have the full Photoshop program loaded on mine and it works perfectly.  If you need a device for business and need to whiz through your work at lightning speed, then you may want to look elsewhere.  But for me, I am very happy – at least so far – with this device.  Again, I heeded the advice noted by other reviewers and chose Manual Setup and I am very happy with the performance of the device.  By the way, the speakers are very nice too and the screen resolution is fine.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value But Take Note...
Reviews.Author: appalachian
Reviews.Content: Pay attention to the other reviews about doing "Custom Setup" the first time you turn on the computer. Choose a time when you are not rushed to do a proper setup and you'll prevent trouble appearing later. Go ahead and setup a Microsoft account at Live.com now to get ready to take advantage of all Windows 8.1 and a Cloud has to offer. It will save a lot of time during computer setup if you already have an account, and you don't need a new e-mail address. You can now get a Microsoft account using any existing e-mail account, including Gmail, Yahoo, local ISP, or your own website's mail. Windows 8.1 takes some getting used to, but if you are a Windows user and have used a touchscreen such as an Android device before, it will be a breeze. If you're one of those still holding on to Windows 95/98/2000 and resist learning new technology, expect a big learning curve requiring lots of time and patience, but well worth it. Vista/7/8 users won't have too much more to learn once you learn where they rearranged everything. XP users... It's just time to bite the bullet.Now, the note...... If you look at the PDF "Datasheet" for this model (bottom of the item page) you will see that it is supposed to come with a 65 Watt "Smart AC Adapter" (the power supply you plug into the wall). However, HP is shipping these with 45 watt Smart AC Adapters (stamped 45W in tiny print on the adapter). You will likely see a HP warning pop-up after Windows starts that says "The Smart AC Adapter you have connected will power your computer at a reduced performance level, and resource intensive tasks may cause your system to not perform at its highest level." Then it says you can buy a higher rated one from HP. When you find your way to the support webpage for this model about batteries and power, it will tell you that "newer computers require a 90 or 130 Watt AC adapter". While I believe the whole thing is aimed at HP selling accessories, the fact remains that the spec sheet calls for a 65 Watt adapter. I corresponded with a lead parts rep who researched it and said they don't even sell 90 or 130 Watt adapters for this model. I agree that's overkill and applies to the larger notebooks instead. However, if someone orders a replacement adapter, they send a 65 Watt adapter. I have one of the older HP 10" Mini's and it uses a 30 Watt adapter, and this model should operate fine with 45 watts of power available. However, I do not know if these new "Smart" adapters have a method of throttling down performance when a 45 Watt adapter is attached, or if it is even possible. When running on battery alone, there isn't an adapter connected at all. The answer is yet to be revealed, but I would NOT let it affect your decision to buy one of these. At 288 bucks, you're still getting a great price, even if you have to buy a 65 Watt adapter later, which is only 25 bucks from HP directly. If your 45 Watt adapter gets hot when your battery is charging AND the applications you are using use a lot of resources, or if your battery doesn't charge when you use resource intensive applications, you definitely need to opt for the 65 Watt Adapter (HP part number 710412-001).Now.... Back to setup. The April 2014 Microsoft updates for Windows 8.1 included a lot of tweaks and feature changes based on user feedback. Therefore, once you're finished setting up, go ahead and download the updates before loading your own software and configuring everything to your own liking. Be sure you look over everything and get the optional updates in addition to the critical updates. Once that's done, if you're an average or above user, go to Control Panel and tweak things such as mouse pointer sensitivity and speed, and other things the way you're used to. Be aware that the "Settings" menu added in Windows 8.1 doesn't have everything. You'll still have to go to Control Panel to find everything, especially advanced settings.Next, to optimize performance and gain some speed, I would go ahead and uninstall applications that you know you'll never need. Since Windows 8.1 has Windows Defender built in and is intended to replace Microsoft's security software Security Essentials (optional free anti-virus and anti-malware used in earlier Windows versions such as XP), I uninstalled McAfee (trial) to get rid of the constant nagging to buy a subscription. If you hang out in dangerous places or want extra security, you might feel better having a more interactive and comprehensive security suite such as Bitdefender, but be aware that these applications are often the culprits that cause sluggish computer performance.OFFICE 2013 STUDENT VERSION. YES!! IT IS INCLUDED with this HP model, and it IS a full working version, NOT a trial version. To unlock it, open Office and activate it using the serial number (key) printed on the yellow card that came in the box with the computer. Look for it loose in the box. It's not in the bag with the other documents.I had to return the first notebook I received because of a letter key that was not aligned correctly and would type when lightly brushed over. That was just a random manufacturing glitch though. Amazon had a replacement on the way same day. Other than that, and the possible issue with the Smart AC Adapter, I have been impressed, especially with the features and performance. I like the convenience and portability of using a small device, but I also need the ability to run production software to keep up with work. Added with the touchscreen features, this provides it all at a cheap price. The keyboard is almost full size (91%) and it's easy to connect a larger monitor and accessories, or dock when needed. It's too early to know where battery performance will settle out at, but so far so good. Everything else is as good or better than the specs and descriptions.

Reviews.Title: Great little laptop.
Reviews.Author: Zandra E. Everett
Reviews.Content: This item was a gift.  But they have told me several times how much they love it.  There were extra features that they didn't expect, like having Netflix.  They have cancelled their cable service and now connect this laptop to their television and watch Netflix. Also, the fact that it's so light weight and can be carried around in a purse or bag is great.

Reviews.Title: decent laptop with reservations
Reviews.Author: Thomas  Brieaddy
Reviews.Content: Pros:1) 2 usb 2.0 connectors (connected a external usb cd/dvd device and works fine). Was able to burn DVDs and play DVDs with very littledegradation (using NERO software).2) 1 usb 3.0 connector.3) 1 full size HDMI connector (works great).4) 1 full size SD connector.5) Windows 8.1 full version. Have installed some Windows 8.1 programs with the external CD/DVD drive and they work fine (unlike the RT versionwhich apparently has no 8.1 compatibility).6) touch screen works and have had no issues with it.7) 320 GB hard drive. Excellent storage and has a SD connector as well as USB connectors.8) dedicated Ethernet connector (haven't had a need to use it yet).9) comes with Microsoft Office.Cons:1) sensitive touch pad. Installed a mouse for most usage and it works fine.2) speed is definitely slower than my current AMD A6 HP 17" inch laptop (with 8GB ram). I would estimate that the 10" laptop is approximately 60to 70% of the speed of my 17" laptop. I uninstalled the included MC Afee internet security and installed my Norton Internet Security and it runsfaster.3) I have previously used 2 different ASUS tablets with detachable keyboards. I returned them because of problems with powering up on both ofthem. Also one of them had the RT version of Windows and I didn't like it. They were both faster than this laptop.4) will sometimes the lose the wifi connection. Does not happen often and easy to reconnect to wifi.

Reviews.Title: It's great once I figured Windows 8 Out
Reviews.Author: DreamingLeo
Reviews.Content: I did what another reviewer did in choosing Manual Settings otherwise everything updates by itself. The setup process is already long enough since everything needs to load, but, Manual Settings will make your life easier. This is my first experience dealing with Windows 8 and I like it now that I have it figured out. I removed all unnecessary tiles and have only the ones I'll need. I got incredibly frustrated and it took about 2 hours but I can deal with it now. It's a little weird having to install apps on a laptop though.This review is about the entire laptop though (not just windows 8) and I chose it because I wanted something portable that I can use for my grad studies without having to buy a 10.1 tablet and a separate keyboard. And at $279 I couldn't really go wrong. It also comes with Office 2013, just don't throw away the small yellow booklet, you'll need it!The touchscreen is incredibly responsive and I found I used that more than the mouse touchpad.One thing I wish it had was a smaller charging cable. Right now it's a regular laptop one, I was kind of hoping for a USB charging mechanism.

Reviews.Title: I like it.
Reviews.Author: Linskey
Reviews.Content: Well, I was going to get a tablet. But then I realized that I needed a keyboard for it. And that they don't have much memory. I'd have to buy more memory And that I really prefer windows so I can load my programs. So I asked myself, why not just get a small computer? So I ordered this for a very good price on a lightning deal on black Friday ($227).NOTE: I hate windows 8. So I downloaded classic shell and now it looks and functions very much like windows 7.If you are like me and have limited internet bandwidth available each month, go to the library immediately before it starts upgrading itself. It wants to do about a gigs worth of upgrades between windows and the HP support assistance thingie. So turn off the automatic updates right away if you don't want any huge download surprises.Oh - and when you upgrade with the support assistant, it's like my other HP laptop - it tells you to do the same upgrades again after you do them. Seems to be typical for HP for some reason.So in conclusion, it will be a great netbook for traveling. Small enough to be convenient but a big enough hardrive to load up with movies and such.I'll update if I encounter problems, but so far, I'd recommend it. Especially if you want something small but a tablet doesn't fill your needs.

Reviews.Title: Just as Described
Reviews.Author: James P. Scott "I commute 125 miles each way ...
Reviews.Content: Before purchasing, I read the specs, and I read the reviews.  The specs were exactly correct, and the reviews were largely incorrect.This cute little computer is just as just as described.  It is small.  It has no optical (CD/DVD) drive.  The memory is limited.  If you are looking for a traditional, full-size laptop, buy something else.  If you are looking for a small, ultra-portable, Windows 8 Notebook, this is your baby.  Read the other review which details how to set it up.  DO NOT USE EXPRESS SETUP!!!

Reviews.Title: Microsoft Office Problems and Awful HP customer service
Reviews.Author: M. J. Tenerelli "MJ"
Reviews.Content: So I bought this notebook because of the price,  decent reviews and because it came with Microsoft Office. Did the custom install as recommended.  After using computer for an hour or so I suddenly had a split screen I couldn't get rid of. Finally did a factory reset which corrupted office. So go to Microsoft and they tried but couldn't fix it. Tell me to.get in touch with HP. That tech tries to download the trial version of Office. I tell him I have product key and it is a full version. He insists this is impossible, computer came with trial. Tired of arguing with him. Call Amazon ...they are great will take computer back and offer to replace. Taking the refund. No more HP computers for me, because customer service is so awful. Computer itself slow despite custom set up.

Reviews.Title: Happy, happy, happy!!
Reviews.Author: SylviaChris
Reviews.Content: I am a traveling nurse so this small laptop is exactly what I needed!  I love it.  It has its moments but for the most part, I find it useful  95% of the time. I am still learning how to operate it.

Reviews.Title: Love It As My First...
Reviews.Author: Shannelle L.
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for myself because I needed to buy my first laptop for my online classes that I signed up for. I must say for this to be my first laptop that I've ever bought, this was a great buy. I love the fact that it's a touch screen, and of course it serves its purpose. It's a great first buy. So far I've been able to get my homework done and upload photos from both of my iphones (almost 2,000 photos). My sister gave my all the information as to whether or not this was a good buy and for what I paid for it, it was a GREAT buy. Thanks so much.

Reviews.Title: From a MAC Fanatic, Two-Thumbs UP!  (With one proviso...)
Reviews.Author: Robert Anderson
Reviews.Content: I often say, "You have a friendship with your MAC, but a PC is a really good tool!"That's my proviso up front.  Macs are light-years beyond PCs; they are intuitive, cool, classy, and empower the owner like nothing else.  A PC, however, is just a computer.  And I gave this HP laptop 5-stars because (even though being merely a computer) it has some great features and it IS fulfilling my PC needs.  My needs: having an inexpensive computer I can take on the road which enables me to access two essential apps that I can't get on my otherwise-awesome MAC: vectorvest-dot-com, an online investment service, and an antiquated, mostly forgotten MSDOS program from 1988: Lotus Agenda.  Nobody has duplicated Agenda's genius for organizing ideas and data--  nobody, not even close.  It's gotten me through some multi-million dollar productions that had tons of crazy details I had to keep track of or else I would have died a painful death. Therefore, this Mac fanatic totes around a PC with no shame or apologies.The HP Pavilion touch screen is a very nice feature!  The battery life is totally adequate.  The size of the laptop and screen is perfect. Kudos.One of my gripes about PCs is how unintuitive and rigid the architecture is... a PC requires you to learn IT'S ways instead of the other way around -- already knowing what you're needs and wants are so you can spend all your time producing, creating, designing, working... However, I feel this PC gives enough clarity of navigation and usability so that it makes up for its foundational faults (that of not being a MAC).  Oh, and did I mention that I'm a MAC fanatic?Good product, great price, wonderful tool.  If this PC got lost or stolen, I'd race to get a replacement.

Reviews.Title: My niece loves it.
Reviews.Author: NC
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for my niece's 18th birthday who lives with me. It works well and suits her needs--she is very happy with it. It is light enough for her to use lounging in bed and to carry to school for note taking. The student version of Office included makes this a excellent buy. This came with the wrong power adapter in the box (came with a 45 watt but needs the 65 watt) which was a real surprise to HP when I called, they rushed me the right one and called me latter to make sure everything was working properly. The setup tips for Windows 8 from other reviewers are worth paying attention to.

Reviews.Author: Angela M. Scanlan
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my little laptop!  Love the touchscreen part, much quicker than having to type or to work the mouse.

Reviews.Title: good for what it is.
Reviews.Author: Tyler D. Klenow
Reviews.Content: good computer for low level use.  Speed is not as snappy as iI would like, but the price is right.

Reviews.Title: Always get HP!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I had an ASUS tablet for 5 months and had so many issues with it, so I was so happy when I discovered this HP notebook for sale.  It was not available on the market when I got the ASUS or I would have bought HP in the first place.  It's the perfect size and weight for me.  I use it for doing my personal bookkeeping, word processing, power points, spreadsheets, email, and internet.  It's not quite as fast as the ASUS, but now that I have all my files and software loaded, I'll do some cleanup and hopefully speed things up.The keyboard is just like the ASUS transleeve with Function keys across the top.  It's so  nice to have one cord that stays plugged in all the time I'm home and having 3 USB ports available instead of dealing with a bunch of adapters and cables and cords just to get everything I need to use--mouse, flash drive, backup drive, etc.  It does not have a CD/DVD drive, but if I need something on a disc, I take it to my church or work and copy it to my flash drive, and I haven't had any problems with doing it that way.I uninstalled the MS Office that came on the notebook because I already had a 2010 Pro version that I uninstalled from my tablet and moved to this new HP notebook.The one thing I need and haven't found yet is an adapter to go from USB to 15-pin VGA so I can connect to the projector at church for power point use.

Reviews.Title: Buyer befair
Reviews.Author: jerry t rosi
Reviews.Content: I bought it as a gift, for the price it was more than I expected. those who know laptops were so impressed they couldn't leave it alone.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Barbara Custard
Reviews.Content: This tablet/laptop is just that, perfect for me as a student.  I love that it is so light I can just drop it in my bag and go.  I also didn't have any problems with downloading windows to it.  I guess if I were to change anything, I would add DVD capability to it.  But it still gets 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Laptop!
Reviews.Author: Charles H
Reviews.Content: This little laptop is awesome! It works great for surfing the net, using Microsoft office (which is included free), streaming movies, and just about anything else you may want to do. I do not know about online gaming, but with only 2gb of ram I would think you may need something  a little more powerful for that. For everyday use I could not recommend this laptop highly enough. The mouse pad works just as good as any I have used, and the touch screen works better than I could have hoped. When zooming in on pictures using the touch screen, I expected the picture would get out of focus. This was not the case. The picture quality stays clear and crisp. I did use the custom set up instead of express as suggested in other reviews, and have had no problems with this computer being slow. Everything loads and plays fast. For the price, I can not imagine you will find a better laptop on the market.

Reviews.Title: HP PC
Reviews.Author: Sheri L. Valentas-Basden
Reviews.Content: I am extremely pleased with my purchase ! I would not hesitate to purchase electronics thru Amazon again. I did however see the very same PC at Office Max for $10.00 cheaper.

Reviews.Title: Buy More than One
Reviews.Author: Engineer_in_Paradise
Reviews.Content: Definitely Underrated. This is a great laptop with the same footprint as a tablet or a chromebook; except it has everything the user needs to do stand-alone home computing. The only drawback is the clumsy, Windows 8.1 which has changed a number of established (20-year) keystrokes and taken away the "START" menu.HP did a great job on this machine. I wish it came in more than one colour.

Reviews.Title: Nice Computer
Reviews.Author: Angela B. Cain
Reviews.Content: This laptop is working well.My 12-year-old son likes it.The touchscreen is very useful.It's screen is smaller than I would like for myself.

Reviews.Title: can't beat the price
Reviews.Author: Julio Corella
Reviews.Content: i love this net book is small and fun, my first touchscreen computer, battery last a long time, mainly use for surfing the net and diagnosing vehicle, perfect for my need could not ask for more.

Reviews.Title: Slow - don't give it too much to do at once
Reviews.Author: DebinNH "Animal lover"
Reviews.Content: The size, keyboard, and touchscreen are good for me, and it introduced me painfully to Windows 8. I also wanted it for the current MS Office tools which are fine. My issue is that if I tried browsing (fiber connection) and opened a couple windows to try to do some multitasking, it couldn't keep up, and sometimes locked.

Reviews.Title: Great computer for my Son
Reviews.Author: Kendall L Anderson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer for my very computer literate autistic son. He loves it. I did follow the advice about the updates that someone posted, and I did not have any problems at all. So glad I went with this HP!

Reviews.Title: Good value for the money.
Reviews.Author: S Johnson
Reviews.Content: Bought here to work with 5th and 6th grade students.  These work well as long as you don't open too many things at once.  The students like the touch screen for familiar swipe based application and the keyboard for typing.  The small form and battery life make these very easily moved from class to class. A good value.

Reviews.Title: First Impressions are very good.
Reviews.Author: Edward Gaffney
Reviews.Content: Still getting used to the touch screen but the computer is nice and does a good job and I like it a lot.

Reviews.Title: HP 10-e010nr touch screen laptop
Reviews.Author: Larry Steinert
Reviews.Content: Love it ,a friend just purchased one new and paid quite a bit more for the exact same laptop.This one came as new still had the plastic on it ,looked brand new. Getting used to windows 8 but it performs great.

Reviews.Title: Great little Laptop
Reviews.Author: HUAN HUU NGUYEN
Reviews.Content: I follow the advice of one of the review and I am very happy with this little gem. Good workmanship and quality and it has Microsoft Word already installed.

Reviews.Title: Great little computer, it is NOT slow!
Reviews.Author: Joanna
Reviews.Content: Just want to thank D. Cushman for the excellent review.  Because of you, I am very happy with this little computer.  I have absolutely no problem with the computer being too slow.  It is just what I wanted, but for very little money.  Thank you again.

Reviews.Title: I love this lap top
Reviews.Author: Gina Marie Ann Kirwin
Reviews.Content: I love this lap top, it's the best lap top I ever had! It's perfect because I can do all of my school stuff on it and I can bring it to school anytime. It's simple and easy to use, even though I had 25 viruses; but other than that it's fast and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: First class
Reviews.Author: Eugene F. Kranz
Reviews.Content: Took a while to come up to speed on windows 8 but afterwards this is exactly what I needed for travel.  The MS Office that was included  was a real bonus, keyboard is nearly full sized gave me no problems and screen is first class.

Reviews.Title: It's great for what it is. A small laptop with Windows 8.1 and MS Office.
Reviews.Author: CheapGeek "Do it for Cheap, Find it for Cheap...
Reviews.Content: Review of the 10 inch HP Pavilion 10 TouchSmart Notebook PC(HP 10-e010nr)Sometimes a Tablet or an iPad doesn't cut it.Sometimes you just need a small laptop.A small, real, computer.This is a small, $300.00 laptop with MS Office,a touchscreen and Windows 8.1.I'm using it for travel.Battery life is good, the display is bright, the touchscreen is convenient,USB 2.0 / 3.0, HDMI, 320GB hard drive, dual core processor and it functions well.It's zippy for what it is.It's great for what it is.I like it so far!

Reviews.Title: Worked okay but you gotta wonder why it's a touch screen
Reviews.Author: Bookish In Seattle
Reviews.Content: Worked okay but you gotta wonder why it's a touch screen, I mean, you can't move the keyboard out of the way.  HP is a reliable product and getting it at AMAZON is a no-brainer as they make sure you get what you order.

Reviews.Title: Meets my expectations and needs
Reviews.Author: RegNYC
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop as my "travel laptop".  I wanted something light, small, and that was a PC v. a tablet.  While the touchscreen was not a deciding factor at the time of purchase, I love it.  I really like being able to use the keyboard for typing and the touchscreen for navigating through the aps, etc.  That's great.  This is a small laptop and I don't think it's too sturdy, certainly not as sturdy as my bigger HP laptop.  However, that laptop is heavy and  I use this mostly as my travel laptop and/or couch sitting.  I love the PC sharing between my what is now my "Home" laptop and this one.  Oh, I also didn't want to pay a lot of money.  I think this is great value and I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great for my High schooler
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: This was easy to set up(except for our email account)!  Great little computer that meets his needs.  Disappointed that Windows makes a Pop email account difficult to set up!  Otherwise everything was as it said!

Reviews.Title: The Only Redeeming Feature of This Highly Impractical Device is Its Build Quality
Reviews.Author: Vahram
Reviews.Content: It's sturdy, truly portable and packs a 10.1" touchscreen which is impressive considering its price point. The Microsoft Office product key was also a nice touch.The drawbacks far outweigh the advantages however. It simply does not have the hardware required for running the OS let alone the bloatware that comes pre-installed with it. It immediately felt sluggish and almost inoperable (no exaggeration). The horrible performance lasted even after I formatted the drive and manually uninstalled the bloatware. Following the suggestion of the top reviewer, I did choose a custom (as opposed to express) setup and it never gave me the choice of picking which programs to install initially. This was a poor design choice coming from HP, it's unthinkable that this even passed quality control (if it did). It's slower than anything I've ever used and I'm accustomed to slow college library PC's. It lags every few seconds and even ceases to respond more frequently than any brand new PC should.In short, it doesn't fulfill its basic role as a computer. The only reason I didn't give it a 1 star is because of the build quality which should be irrelevant anyway since the laptop has virtually no performance at all. I've already contacted Amazon Support and they have emailed me a return slip. I will be shipping the laptop back in a day from now.

Reviews.Title: i am 70% satisfied
Reviews.Author: annette tanner
Reviews.Content: it's not the fastest computer, it's good for traveling. i'm having a hard time getting used to windows 8.1,, the touchscreen is nice

Reviews.Title: great computer
Reviews.Author: MaryJane
Reviews.Content: This is a great small computer for our students. It functions well, is economical, easily transported, and up to date.

Reviews.Title: Second try satisfactory
Reviews.Author: J. K. Lowman
Reviews.Content: Excellent performance but first one had a defective hard drive  according to data transfer techRetailer replaced without hassle best buy

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Li Feng
Reviews.Content: I change it to "HP Pavilion 11-e110nr 11-Inch Touchsmart Laptop" because it's a little slow on it's 2g memory.  The others are good.

Reviews.Title: Very good value
Reviews.Author: Robin Rios
Reviews.Content: I like this product for its size and even its shape. I was looking for something like this. Small and practical.

Reviews.Title: Nice little touchscreen laptop, but a little slow.
Reviews.Author: Terry N. Weber
Reviews.Content: For my purposes this little computer is fine. I am using it now. I wanted it for our vacations and it is adequate for that. It would be nice if it was a little faster, though.

Reviews.Title: Wow, It Has a Touch Screen, Too!
Reviews.Author: T. H. Pine "The WordWorker"
Reviews.Content: Tired of carry a shoulder-dislocating full-size laptop, I got "this little beauty" for when I travel. It has all the laptop features (including a fairly complete keyboard), plus a touch screen, which is a great idea for the smart-phone, tablet generation. It's a solid compromise for the weary traveler at a more-than-reasonable price (under $300) for a mini with these sort of features. Note: comes with Windows 8.

Reviews.Title: The HP computer seems to be very good quality. I like the feel of the keys.
Reviews.Author: James A Hampton
Reviews.Content: Windows 8.1 was so much different from Windows Vista my wife had a very hard time using this computer. We both are finally getting better with 8.1. The computer works fine and the quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Arizona Jones
Reviews.Content: This computer is a great buy!  This was so much better than just buying a tablet!!!  It's about the same size as a tablet, has so much more to offer!!!

Reviews.Title: Great computer, lousy operating system
Reviews.Author: Joann L. Allen "Jody"
Reviews.Content: I am loving the touch screen and the size of the keyboard. The set up is great and it performs well. It does come with a full version of Windows 8.1, there is a yellow card in the box to activate the full version. That said, I HATE WINDOWS 8.1! I wish I could have gotten this computer with Windows 7. That is why I cannot give this item 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: almost a full laptop
Reviews.Author: Renegade HOG
Reviews.Content: Nice compact unit.  Great for taking on road trips when you want more then a tablet but don't need the bulk of a laptop. Once you learn to accept that is not quite as responsive as a full laptop it is a worthy travel companion.  Battery life is good as is the display.

Reviews.Title: I'm Letting the Rating Speak for Itself
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: a little slow and getting use to 8.1 but otherwise nice size and does the job for travel. I'm not really into writing the product reviews so adding this filler to satisfy the required number of works.

Reviews.Title: A good laptop
Reviews.Author: zlmeng
Reviews.Content: HP Pavilion 10-e010nr 10.1-Inch Touchscreen Laptop is a good laptop. It's smart and very light! I like it very much!

Reviews.Title: HP Pavilion 10-e010nr
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Maes
Reviews.Content: Very light, very nice looking, very easy to use.  The battery does not seem to last very long and the speaker volume is not very loud at 100%.  It was not sparkling black.  It is Silver.

Reviews.Title: Machine is OK  "free software deals" REALLY stink
Reviews.Author: Martin Kilgore
Reviews.Content: I can take the transition to windows 8.1 but what I absolutely hate are the pop-ups and assorted dreck that they loaded on this puppy. Right out of the box it is constantly intruding with all sorts of sneaky and agravating attempts to make you buy useless add-ons.read EVERYTHING before you click "accept".  If they are that sneaky, why would you want them to get your money?

Reviews.Title: keep telling me the ac adaptor is wrong one when i turn on laptop
Reviews.Author: In My Old Age "Jean"
Reviews.Content: every time i plug in the charger  that came with it the system say it is a lower wattage than should be and system may not run as well because of it. annoying to have to click ok on that every time plug in. Otherwise i love the touch screen and the laptop so far performs well. Rated only 3 stars for selling it with a charger the system says is wrong, otherwise be 5 stars. And i did use custon setup < not express as others said too. Updated- have up to 4 stars for amazon great customer service about charger problem.

Reviews.Title: review
Reviews.Author: Robert Consla
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the performance and user friendly ability of this product. It lacks a little in the hardware muscle that I am use to having, but more in makes up for that in portability and user friendly design. I would purchase another or two for my family if I had the financial mens available.

Reviews.Title: Computer
Reviews.Author: Cristino Mavinga
Reviews.Content: Is a smart computer you can use keyboard or touch it is amaizing.quick good for student or traveling thanks for advice.

Reviews.Title: Working great!
Reviews.Author: Briana Sykes
Reviews.Content: Purchased this laptop because I needed something small but with more capabilities than a netbook. So far very pleased with performance. Did follow recommendation of previous owners to complete set up manually instead if quick set up.

Reviews.Title: Solid contruction and good performance.
Reviews.Author: Steven D,. Lewis
Reviews.Content: You get a lot for the money.  Can run just about everything and quite responsive.  Once you master the touch screen you can do about anything!

Reviews.Title: Just as advertised
Reviews.Author: Dan Crawford
Reviews.Content: This product was just as it said it would be. Arrived quick, and in perfect condition. Software installation was perfect and fast to setup.  I recommend this product and re-seller.

Reviews.Title: Happy with it
Reviews.Author: Gustavo Puma
Reviews.Content: At the beginning, I had some trouble setting it up, but now it works pretty good, the touch screen feature is fantastic. The price really good.

No cons, its perfect at its price.==Windows 8.1 Tips & Computing Safety==Bring back the start button: Installing one of these two software will help new Windows8.1 users to ease into "Modern" user interface of windows 8.11) Classic Shell (free) or 2) Start8 (Stardock $5)___________________________________________________________________Avoiding major damages caused by those pesky malware,virus etc by simply not using an "Administrator Account" with your main MS Account.Viruses will likely cause more damage and will be impossible to completely remove if they gained Admisitrator's right and  have dug deep inside your computer.  An "Administrators" account is a backdoor route viruses/malware uses get in and cause unrecoverable distruction to your data. With Admin rights those malware can easily infect deep within your "recovery partitions'! meaning, these's not turning back and you're royally screwed. Theres many more problems that can happen but I think you already get my point.GOALS: 1) Don't use your Main MS Account as an" Adminitrator" but instead "standard"  2) Create a secondary account called "local account" and set that up as the Administrator instead.Account Management: steps creating a local account(administrator) and MS Account(standard)Charms search: type"control panel" > "User's Accounts and Family Safety" > "Remove User account" > " Add a new user in PC settings " located at bottom of window > Bringing you to Metro > click "add Account" > "Sign in without MS accout" located at bottom of page > "Local Accout" > create new user name and PWYou have 2 options on Signing IN1) Microsoft account or 2) Local Account1) Create or sign in with your MAIN Microsoft Account. If you already an MS account or uses windows phones/ xbox live or Hotmail/live/MSN email address you can use these as well to link those services to 1 master MS Account.2) Create a Local Account. Thise secondary account will not connect to MS's ecosytem but only in your local computer. I identical to USERS login on Windows 7,Vista,XP etc.Once you've setup these two accounts, you must set each account type to: >Change ACCOUNT TYPE for Main MS Account to "Standard"Change ACCOUNT TYPE for 2ndary Local Account to "Administrator"Please do these steps, it only takes 5minutes.  Its a small price to pay considering, it may  potentially rescue your entire data from a completely erasing your data after sending it for repairs.__________________________________________________________________________Making Back ups/ EtcAnother tip is to make a recovery image.First install Setup all your programs , setup your custom settings, etcAfter personalizing your PC.  > Its time to Create a Recovery Image right after you've set everything up.  This image will allow you to revert back to this pc's state in time, and in perfect working order.Sometimes system recovery doesn't solve your problems so having secondary backup plan like Recovery Image is key.________________________________________________________________________Not optional, must practice these 3 regular computing habits.#1  (Install McAfee Antivirus, which is now free starting 2014, per Intel's 2014 Keynote at CES) or Paid programs such as Kaspersky Internet Security 2014  is the leading software in the market today. $50.  These programs scans your system automatically, so set it and forget it.#2  (Install MalwareBytes/free, scan your pc every month with this program or sooner when you feel like your system is sluggish or seeing webpages poping up that you didnt click)  Because this is a free software, as a user you must manually start the scaning process or by buying retail version you'll unlock the auto scan scheduler feature.#3  (Install Superantispyware/free, Scan pc every 2wks)Because this is a free software, as a user you must manually start the scaning process or by buying retail version you'll unlock the auto scan scheduler feature.Its ok skip a few scans between months, although not advisable, especially if your a heavy web surfing maniac spending 2-3 hrs daily websurfing not just facebooking.  But please dont go without using all 3 programs more than 5-8 Months in between scans.________________________________________________________________________Another way to avoid  spreading your personal information out there into the wild unknowingly is to un-google yourself.yes ladies and gents! google or yahoo especially yahoo LOL..... but google is key here.Microsoft sells Primarily Software.Apple sells Primarily HardwareGoogle sells neither, that's why their products are so CHEAP, once they suckered in their backdoor ridden ecosystem, Google Inc. sells Primarily Everything about YOU!_____________________________________________________________________________________________________Steps in upgrading from Windows 8 to Windows 8.1  (2-3hrs)Key here is to ensure your windows 8 is fully updated before upgrading to win8.1Therefore repeatedly "check of updates" on windowsHow to upgrade to windows 8.1 for dummies.Step 1: Go to Metro and not desktopStep 2: Start typing : "Control Panel"Step 3: Click "Windows Update" > "Check for Update"Step 4: install updatesStep 5: restart computerStep 6: Repeat step 1 -5 until result "no more updates"Step 7: Run HP Update client, install all updates from HP to ensure all drivers and bugfixes are updated.( or whichever OEM you may have, lenovo,dell, sony etc.)Step 8: Uninstall your Antivirus Software (important) then RESTART PCStep 9: Go to Windows Store and upgrade to 8.1Step 10: leave computer on for 2hrs as it upgrades.Step 11: Repeat Steps 1 - 7Step 12: if you're not a complete fool, 8.1 upgrade should be straight forward. \After steps 1-8 ONLY THEN you should install WIndows 8.1 at the marketplace. Goodluck.(note: steps above removes a lot of failures users experience after 8.1 update)___________________________________________________________Not many want to shell out their dollars on Office 360  if all they intend of using is standard word processors.you can use a free web version of office calledBing.com search:  "MS Office Web Apps"just sign in with the same  MS Account user name used on your PC.

Reviews.Title: This is a tablet with a keyboard attached
Reviews.Author: Michael DeRose
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how this has an average rating of 4 stars or how I have not smashed it to pieces yet.  Suitable for a child or occasional browsing if you don't mind loading time. I'm giving mine away. If you want a real laptop, this is not one.

Reviews.Title: Slow, irratic.
Reviews.Author: Norman Rose
Reviews.Content: Very slow starting and loading.  Windows 8 is hampered by slow response.  Insulted by on screen note that says the power supply furnished with the computer is not the best one and that I would get better performance by buying an upgraded power supply.

Reviews.Title: would not buy again
Reviews.Author: Shou Hamasaki
Reviews.Content: I needed a Windows computer for one application I use that stopped running on Windows xp. I bought this computer rather than buy a copy of parallels or VMware Fusion and windows. The computer is very slow. It suffers from random reboots and lock ups. And it is very difficult to use. Even though it has an hdmi port, I cannot get it to work properly with my projector.I had to install the Winx key and god mode in order to get it to work properly at all. even when I get that, it doesn't compare to a MacBook Air. I can't stand windows Metro style. The lack of a backlit keyboard is unfortunate. The computer is hard to open requiring two hands.

Reviews.Title: processor so slow
Reviews.Author: linda henry
Reviews.Content: I wish I sent it back.  My internet is high speed and home computer even though it is old is still way faster then this, also freezes often when downloading files, small ones , big ones size does not matter in this case.  Very disappointed.  Wasted my money and I try not to use it much because it is very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: BLedgerSmith
Reviews.Content: I didn't think I would like the touch screen. Now I can't be without it.  Windows 8 is still giving me problems, but this too, shall pass.

Reviews.Title: This computer is unusable....
Reviews.Author: william m. metcalf jr.
Reviews.Content: I was excited about the touchscreen features etc. Couldn't even install office without the system memory (ram) becoming bogged down.. I returned it the same day, which I believe is a first. I hardly ever return anything. If you are on the fence spend a little more money and get something else. This computer would be fine for the Android or Chrome OS but not for Windows 8.1.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop for the Money
Reviews.Author: harley2U
Reviews.Content: This computer has a solid construction.  With Windows 8.1 loaded as well as the full version of MS Office Home & Student - along with a HD of 320 GB - this is a great value for the $.  Setup was a breeze.  We bought a cheap wireless mouse to go along with it, as well as the 900+ page book, The Missing 8.1 Manual.  We're in our 70th year and find that the keyboard size is not an issue.  While we're not big on touching the screen to accomplish tasks - in some ways - it is convenient.  We probably could have lived without that.  Nevertheless, the convenient part is the ability to quickly increase the size of the font presented.  As a retired accountant, I do miss the 10-key that my full size Laptop has - but again, that is available as a touch-screen presentation.  Of course we like the convenient Desktop feature.

Reviews.Title: Slow?
Reviews.Author: G. Alvin Simons "Author of Odin-son:The Berse...
Reviews.Content: I'm not really sure why so many folks are saying the HP is slow but I certainly won't dispute them. Mine is fine. I really appreciate D. Cushman's warning to not use Express set up. I used Custom & found it very easy to do. No, it doesn't come with WORD other than a brief introductory offer of Student Office that you'll have to eventually pay for. I paid $140 for a basic Office version that includes WORD, EXCEL, POWERPOINT, & ONENOTE which is all I need. Yes, the keyboard is smaller than full-size, but I have large, clumsy fingers & have had no problem using it. I am delighted with my purchase & would easily recommend it to others keeping in mind its limitations. I wanted something small & light that I can carry with me to work on my novels, WORD, & do financials, EXCEL. This thing perfectly fits the bill. Yes, I can also access the internet, but don't use it for that. Anyone trying to find the time & capability to work on their writing wherever they happen to be will appreciate this laptop. The only other suggestion I'd pass on is to buy a carrying case larger than needed to fit the laptop into. I paid $20 for a Case Logic 14.1" carrying case & have enough room for the laptop, charging cord, a mouse (I've never liked a touchpad no matter who makes it) & my small writing notebook.

Reviews.Title: It is so useful and light just like I Pad : )
Reviews.Author: Mikyung S. Bremer
Reviews.Content: I brought it with me when I went to business trip to Chicago. I could do presentation and organizing the competitors' list. Also I used Excel for count the scores for competetion. I was so happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Shows promise, but some bad pixels and trouble launching MS Office that comes with it.
Reviews.Author: Echosonic
Reviews.Content: Shows promise for a very portable laptop with functional touchscreen, but unit I received had 3 bad pixels in the same place. Also I activated the MS Office that came with it, but for some reason the start icon box for it disappeared and I could not find a way to bring up office at all. So anyhow I am returning it for a replacement to correct the pixels, but if anyone else has had the start icon disappear I would like to know how to keep that from happening!! on my second try with this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Laurie Dahlstrom
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect size for traveling or if I want to sit on the patio and answer emails or do research. Still getting used to Windows 8.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my 9 year old!
Reviews.Author: CRYSTALC0523
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my 9 year old daughter for her birthday and it was the perfect choice in size and style. I reviewed many laptops in size,brand, and style. She loves the touch screen and I have found myself reverting to her laptop instead of my own. The screen is perfect a little hard to see sometimes, but when you utilize the touch for zooming it works out perfect.

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop
Reviews.Author: Cindy R Tinsley
Reviews.Content: The perfect size if you are looking for a good laptop to travel with or just using around the house.

Reviews.Title: Delivers all I asked for.  Had difficulty finding the microsoft programs included and not sure yet that I have them where they
Reviews.Author: connie
Reviews.Content: Delivers all I asked for.  Had difficulty finding the microsoft programs included and not sure yet if I have them where they need to be.

Reviews.Title: Basically like except seems to have a mind of its own when you flips from screen to screen, changes size, etc. out of the clear!
Reviews.Author: M Queen
Reviews.Content: I really like my HP Pavillon 10-e010nr except my 4G wireless card seems to drop easily and sometimes the screens flash from one to another without my doing anything.  This can be annoying and frustrating at times.  But I am still getting used to it and overall I like it.

Reviews.Title: small - light weight
Reviews.Author: Susie
Reviews.Content: was looking for a small light weight computer, so far it is good -- still trying to understand the windows 8 - working with the windows 8 for dummies - senior edition - so if I can get through the small book and understand what I am trying to learn ====only downfall so far is - description reads (Sparkling black)  not sure where the black part is -- the keyboard??? mine is silver on the outside --- not a big deal

Reviews.Title: IT JUST WHAT IM LOOKING FOR
Reviews.Author: STEVEN   CARLEY
Reviews.Content: IT FOR MY DAUGHTER AND SHE SAID IT JUST WHAT SHE NEEDS SO WE BOTH VERY HAPPY  THANX  AND  WE WILL ORDER MUCH MORE PRODUCTS AUCH AS THAT

Reviews.Title: Great but!
Reviews.Author: Wilson
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 13 yr old for Christmas. I saw a similar version of this product for the same price in a sales ad for Black Friday at a dept. Store.  I did not want to fight the crowds so I ordered this laptop.  I couldn't believe how fast it was shipped.  I ordered it on a Tuesday and it came to me on Friday (Black Friday!).  So happy with the service and my son loved the laptop.  It was perfect for him.

Reviews.Title: Computer is very slow
Reviews.Author: a customer
Reviews.Content: I received my computer today and I found out that the computer is very slow.  I called HP service and asked her to help me to remove the unneeded programs from the startup, HP service would like me to pay for this.  Then I asked whether HP has a web page so that I can follow the directions to uninstall the programs from the startup, so that my computer can be faster.  There is no such a help page.  It is a bad experience for me so far.

Reviews.Title: MEETS ALL OF ME EXPECTASIONS FROM HP
Reviews.Author: Jean Bolin Teste "Jean Bolin Teste"
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd computer from HP.  They keep up with the times and stand by their products.Jean Bolin Teste

Reviews.Title: Hardest to configure laptop ever!
Reviews.Author: Steven D. Recker
Reviews.Content: I was quite excited to get this, since it's kind of a cross between an iPad and a laptop.  Windows 8 is horrible!  The laptop is actually great!  I blame Microsoft, not HP.  I spent hours and hours trying to get the email function to work. I also tried to join this laptop to a home group to share a printer.  It did join the homegroup, but then it could not see the printer, even though I have other Windows devices sharing the same printer on the same homegroup.  Everything is difficult to use from simply closing a window to changing to another application.  After you download the applications that you might use like Amazon, Facebook, etc. the icons have scrolling messages that don't say what the application is.  You have to figure out that the tiny letter A in the bottom corner is Amazon, while the entire icon is giving you scrolling shopping messages.  It's the same thing with email or any other application.  It doesn't come with Office either, that costs a lot extra.  After days of google searches to guide me through even the basics on this computer, I finally gave up and sent it back.

Reviews.Title: HP pavilion 10-e010hr 10 inch touchscreen laptop
Reviews.Author: june muray
Reviews.Content: Because it doesn't work - have been on vac - now will have to call to see if they will send me one that works - also now I have to send it back

Reviews.Title: computer
Reviews.Author: Sharon E Justice
Reviews.Content: was full of viruses according to tech, could not get computer to work at all.  Tried everything I knew before calling for help.

Reviews.Title: Ok computer
Reviews.Author: Emily Gillispie
Reviews.Content: This computer is very basic. It does not seem very durable. We do not like how slow the track pad is and can't seem to speed it up. We also don't like the Windows 8 operating system. It plays videos just fine and you can get around the internet ok. We're considering sending this back.

Reviews.Title: Window 8.1
Reviews.Author: Thuan Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Touchscreen Laptop is down load App too slow and I had to convert to window 7 from window 8.1 to make my work done.....

Reviews.Title: Up and running
Reviews.Author: D. K. Ermer
Reviews.Content: I had serious problems getting off the ground with this product. I am not the most intuitive user.  The problems centered around getting the Microsoft Home and Student software up and running.  I think it could have been better managed. However, Amazon came to the rescue and after a month or so of going between HP and Amazon, things got straightened out.  I am finding the device handy and consider it worth the price for my intended uses.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work out of box
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer for my wife for Christmas.  It arrived quickly so I wrapped it and put it under the tree.  Christmas morning she opened it and it wouldn't load.  I spent an hour on the phone with HP tech support.  They verified the hard drive was bad, and offered to replace it.  Told them I would deal with Amazon.  I'll probably just exchange it for the same thing and try my luck.  Very disappointing, especially on Christmas morning.

Reviews.Title: Not impressive.
Reviews.Author: Melissa M Blount
Reviews.Content: Was not impressed.  Response time was pretty slow.  Felt as though the touch screen was too jumpy and flipped between applications frequently, causing a lot of frustration.  Did not feel this product was a good value for the price.  It would probably be OK for occasional use.  Would not recommend for student or primary use.

Reviews.Title: Burning Money is a Wiser Investment
Reviews.Author: BK
Reviews.Content: You may find yourself in search of a new computing device. You may be enticed by the allure of unnecessary features, product claims, or the wolf in sheep's clothing that is affordability of HP products. But for the greater good, I believe it is my obligation to inform the public that HP is a confidence man-like manufacturer of over-priced, disposable laptops. If you're looking for a product that will fail within a year of the purchase or, in many cases, just after the one year manufacturer's warranty has expired, then look no further. HP offers a plethora of devices that will burn a hole in your wallet and destroy your faith big business. HP's bottom line is not customer satisfaction, but rather profit maximization while reducing product costs, sometimes at the expense of the consumer. You may be thinking "it won't happen to me" or "defects are rare", but after reading countless reviews, I have come to the conclusion that HP intentionally designs their products to fail just outside their warranty. So when your computing device does break, you find yourself in search of another, which HP hopes you'll come crawling back for round two. Or you may try your luck with HP's notoriously horrid customer service, which just so happens to be outsourced to locations where English competency is more like a peripheral thought. The blatant lack of concern for product quality, durability, and customer service on behalf of HP is a prime example of "buyer beware".
